oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pulsebeat Radio Show: Ray Stevens - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Kim Spangler (host) dictating the Pulsebeat section of the Voice of the Heartland Radio Show. The episode interviews Ray Stevens (musician). The episode was set to air for the week of January 02, 1989. The episode is part 2 of 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kim Spangler; Ray Stevens
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:01) Kim Spangler introduces the upcoming Ray Stevens Pulsebeat show -- (00:37) The Booger Man (Ray Stevens) -- (04:54) Spangler introduces Stevens' musical tastes; additionally, Stevens reveals he wanted to quit playing instruments as a child -- (06:13) Spangler and Stevens discuss if there was truly a record he did not enjoy; additionally, Spangler introduces Stevens' disinterest in branding -- (07:37) Everything is Beautiful (Ray Stevens) -- (11:07) An unidentified voice performs a John Willingham Barbeque commercial spot -- (12:41) Spangler introduces "The Streak" -- (13:03) The Streak (Ray Stevens) -- (16:11) Spangler introduces Stevens' speechless response -- (16:26) Wall of Tears (K. T. Oslin) -- (20:04) An unidentified voice performs a John Willingham Barbeque commercial spot -- (21:46) Spangler praises the lengthy career of Stevens and asks what he would change -- (22:22) Guitarzan (Ray Stevens) -- (25:21) Unidentified tune [featuring Kim Spangler outro discussion] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Spangler, Kim; Stevens, Ray; Stevens, Ray, 1939-;
